result.execSummary:
The defendant David H Stevens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Huber granted for work and any counseling defendant may be involved in, as well as child care, if approved by jail administration.
*May be reduced to 12 months if defendant complies and completes all conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

*No violent or abusive contact with G.G.
*Engage in Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program if one is available during probation.
*Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David H Stevens in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CM-490 and 16CM-126.

11:28 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Matters were set for a pretrial but parties have agreed to an agreement.

15CM-490 Defendant will plead to both counts.
16CM-126 Defendant will pead to Count 1. Count 2 will be dismissed. Count 3 will be dismissed and read in

Atty Halverson concurs.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY 15CM-490 Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY 15CM-490 Count 2
Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY 16CM-126 Count 1

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Halverson for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CM-490 Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CM-490 Count 2: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
16CM-126: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
16CM-126: Count 2: Dismissed outright
16CM-126: Count 3: Dismissed and Read In

11:36 AM Victim addresses the Court.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CM-490:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 90 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for work and any counseling  Defendant may be involved in, as well as child care, if approved by jail administration
Probation for a period of 18 Months
May be reduced to 12 months if Defendant complies and completes all conditions of probation
Conditions:
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
No violent or abusive contact with G.G.
Engage Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program if one is available during probation
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent

Count 2:
Jail sentence for 90 Days, Imposed and Stayed, consecutive to any other jail sentence
Huber granted for work and any counseling  Defendant may be involved in, as well as child care, if approved by jail administration
Probation for a period of 18 Months, concurrent to Count 1
May be reduced to 12 months if Defendant complies and completes all conditions of probation
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge

16CM-126:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 90 Days, Imposed and Stayed, consecutive to all other sentences
3 Days Jail Credit
Huber granted for work and any counseling  Defendant may be involved in, as well as child care, if approved by jail administration
Probation for a period of 18 Months, concurrent to 15CM-490
May be reduced to 12 months if Defendant complies and completes all conditions of probation
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 15CM-490
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge


20 days in which to appeal the cases.
Pre-trial conference on April 11, 2016 at 08:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 4, 2016 at 08:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.
